text:
Room of Kindness

Dim room, Raskolnikov and Sonia, tense mood.  
Sonia: “You rent this room from the Kapernaumovs?”  
Raskolnikov: “Yes….”  
Sonia: “They live there, through that door?”  

---

Same room, Sonia looks bewildered, Raskolnikov observes gloomily.  
Raskolnikov: “I should be afraid at night.”  
Sonia: “They are very kind people.”  

---

Close-up on Sonia, recalling, surprised.  
Sonia: “Your father told me everything….”  
Sonia: “I fancied I saw him today.”  
Raskolnikov: “Whom?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov visits Sonia for what he believes may be the last time, discussing her living situation and the kindness of her landlords.
